title: Justice Department Loses Antitrust Bid to Block Sugar Industry Merger; A federal judge allows U.S. Sugar to acquire Imperial Sugar, the second failed merger challenge this week for antitrust enforcers
text:
The Justice Department, which sued last November to challenge the merger, argued the deal would lead to higher prices for consumers in key parts of the country.

The ruling is the second loss in a merger case this week for the department, after a judge in Washington, D.C., rejected its challenge to UnitedHealth Group Inc.'s $13 billion acquisition of health-technology firm Change Healthcare Inc.

Write to Erin Mulvaney at erin.mulvaney@wsj.com

Justice Department Loses Antitrust Bid to Block Sugar Industry Merger
